org.jppf.jca.demo

Class J2EEDemo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jppf.jca.demo.J2EEDemo

  • public class J2EEDemo
extends Object
    Instances of this class encapsulate a simple call to the JPPF resource adapter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      J2EEDemo(String jndiBinding)
      Initialize this test object with a specified jndi location for the connection factory.

    • Method Detail

      • testConnector

        public String testConnector(int duration)
                     throws Exception
        Perform a simple call to the JPPF resource adapter.
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration of the task to submit.
        Returns:
        a string reporting either the task execution result or an error message.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the call to JPPF failed.

      • testConnector

        public String testConnector(String jobId,
                   long duration,
                   int nbTasks)
                     throws Exception
        Perform a simple call to the JPPF resource adapter.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the name given to the job.
        duration - the duration of the task to submit.
        nbTasks - the number of tasks to submit.
        Returns:
        a string reporting either the task execution result or an error message.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the call to JPPF failed.

      • testMultipleJobs

        public String testMultipleJobs(int nbJobs,
                      String jobNamePrefix,
                      long duration,
                      int nbTasks,
                      boolean blocking)
                        throws Exception
        Perform a simple call to the JPPF resource adapter.
        Parameters:
        nbJobs - the number of jobs to submit.
        jobNamePrefix - the prefix of the name given to each job.
        duration - the duration of each task to submit.
        nbTasks - the number of tasks to submit for each job.
        blocking - whether th jobs are blocking or not.
        Returns:
        a string reporting either the task execution result or an error message.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the call to JPPF failed.

      • testConnectorBlocking

        public String testConnectorBlocking(String jobId,
                           long duration,
                           int nbTasks)
                             throws Exception
        Perform a simple call to the JPPF resource adapter. This method blocks until all job results have been received.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the name given to the job.
        duration - the duration of the task to submit.
        nbTasks - the number of tasks to submit.
        Returns:
        a string reporting either the task execution result or an error message.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the call to JPPF failed.

      • getStatusMap

        public Map getStatusMap()
                 throws Exception
        Get the map of submissions ids to their corresponding submission status.
        Returns:
        a map of ids to statuses as strings.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the call to JPPF failed.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(String id)
                  throws Exception
        Get the resulting message from a submission.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the submission to retrieve.
        Returns:
        a string reporting either the task execution result or an error message.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the call to JPPF failed.
